segment.source: description: Technologies for accessing the network and web services.
segment.target: description: Technologies for accessing the network and web services.

segment.source: title: Networking and web services
segment.target: title: Networking and web services

segment.source: Networking and web services
segment.target: Networking and web services

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: The following networking and web services technologies are available for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) developers.
segment.target: The following networking and web services technologies are available for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) developers.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Networking basics
segment.target: Networking basics

segment.source: Things you must do for any network-enabled app.
segment.target: Things you must do for any network-enabled app.

segment.source: Which networking technology?
segment.target: Which networking technology?

segment.source: A quick overview of the networking technologies available for a UWP developer, with suggestions on how to choose the technologies that are right for your app.
segment.target: A quick overview of the networking technologies available for a UWP developer, with suggestions on how to choose the technologies that are right for your app.

segment.source: Network communications in the background
segment.target: Network communications in the background

segment.source: Apps use background tasks and two main mechanisms to maintain communications when they are not in the foreground: The socket broker, and control channel triggers.
segment.target: Apps use background tasks and two main mechanisms to maintain communications when they are not in the foreground: The socket broker, and control channel triggers.

segment.source: Sockets
segment.target: Sockets

segment.source: You can use both Winsock to communicate with other devices as a UWP app developer.
segment.target: You can use both Winsock to communicate with other devices as a UWP app developer.

segment.source: This topic provides in-depth guidance on using the Windows.Networking.Sockets namespace to perform networking operations.
segment.target: This topic provides in-depth guidance on using the Windows.Networking.Sockets namespace to perform networking operations.

segment.source: WebSockets
segment.target: WebSockets

segment.source: WebSockets provide a mechanism for fast, secure two-way communication between a client and a server over the web using HTTP(S).
segment.target: WebSockets provide a mechanism for fast, secure two-way communication between a client and a server over the web using HTTP(S).

segment.source: HttpClient
segment.target: HttpClient

segment.source: Use Windows.Web.Http namespace API to send and receive information using the HTTP 2.0 and HTTP 1.1 protocols.
segment.target: Use Windows.Web.Http namespace API to send and receive information using the HTTP 2.0 and HTTP 1.1 protocols.

segment.source: RSS/Atom feeds
segment.target: RSS/Atom feeds

segment.source: Retrieve or create the most current and popular Web content using syndicated feeds generated according to the RSS and Atom standards using features in the Windows.Web.Syndication namespace.
segment.target: Retrieve or create the most current and popular Web content using syndicated feeds generated according to the RSS and Atom standards using features in the Windows.Web.Syndication namespace.

segment.source: Background transfers
segment.target: Background transfers

segment.source: Use the background transfer API to copy files reliably over the network.
segment.target: Use the background transfer API to copy files reliably over the network.
